page.title: 17Ampleforth Cadet Force
page.content: Ampleforth College has a Combined Cadet Force comprising three sections: Army, Navy and Air Force. The bulk of the ranks are made up of 14 and 15 year-olds, who have to do 2 years basic training. The rest of the members are volunteers from the senior part of the school. The aim of the CCF is to give the boys an idea of the forces and to encourage those interested in military careers. In the army section the cadets are given basic training in drill, weapons, field crafts and survival. In the Navy the trainees are instructed in ships of the line, navigation, basic drill and take part in army events. The RAF cadets are taught the basic rudiments of flying and put them into practice, in their second year, in the air at RAF Leeming, and on the ground with computer flight simulators.
